you just mentioned your data is precious, I would rather do it manually then -- I wouldnt delete partitions, just back up my data -- then reinstall windows 7

it all depends on how you install, you still havent told me what type of machine you have, but with windows 7 using restore CD some funky things happen,  usually win7 has 2 partitions but a restore utility creats its own, you have to figure out what partition you can delete to create an extended partition

OK well Dell netbooks with XP come with an extra partition to use with the restore utility -- you can delete that one.  In your case, the trick is to find what partition you can delete so you can create an extended partition,

that is what you have to figure out -- what partition you can delete, basically first back up your data - then delete a partition you believe you dont need , reboot to see if windows 7 still works, then create an extended partition and allocate all free space on it
